messages.subject: Re:Control Issues
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 11/19/2001 7:01:00 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... In my opinion. . . there are always psychological factors at play. . . it doesn t make it
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 11/19/2001 7:01:00 AM Eastern Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> All of these and many more CAN be caused by situational factors, such as
> emotional stress. Are they always caused by psychological factors? No. Can
> they be? Yes.
>
>

In my opinion. . . there are always psychological factors at play. . . it
doesn't make it bad that there are, or anyone's "fault". . . it just means
that the mind is a part of the whole and influences the whole, just as any
other part. . . they are all interconnected in the body and are not separate.
. . this is way I believe and see it anyway. :)

lovemary



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
